Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: what does  bad-txns-oversize mean?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@Gordon Komodo Never faced this issue but I guess it means that your transaction is to large to meet consensus rules.

There are at least three reasons a transaction may be too large (as guy in zcash github writing: https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/1970):

a large number of transparent outputs - caused by a large number of recipients
a large number of transparent inputs - caused by a large amount of transparent value
many JoinSplits

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: thanks!

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: did you get that error while z_mergetoaddress in pirate chain @Gordon Komodo

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: not me, somebody else trying to send me coin and he got that

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: ok, while merging  txns we get that error,  one who is miner those address usually have that issue. so, he needs to combine bit of txn to one periodically

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: yeah, he is a miner 😄

Author: DCAL4#9381
Content: Good evening all. Quick question on the interest feature now that it has changed to monthly. Do I need to send my KMD to a new wallet each month or does that mean I need to claim the interest in the same wallet each month? Thanks for your help

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: You will just need to claim the reward in the wallet each month. A reward is generated each time an utxo is spent so if you send to a new address is the same as claiming the reward in your own address. The reward button only automates the sending of your balance to your same public address inside your wallet.

Author: DCAL4#9381
Content: @Hermes Thank you for the clarification👍
